docs.text: OSC API document: Commands

docs.title: OSC API Reference
docs.text: Auto-generated documentation for OSC functions.

docs.title: Configuration Commands
docs.text: These OSC commands allow the user to reconfigure the ShowIO device.

docs.title: Get Device Config
docs.text:
Function: get_cnfg Source: cfg.rs

⚠️ NOTE: WILL BE DEPRECATED ONCE DEVICE CONFIG GETS TOO BIG TO FIT IN A UDP PACKET (or I figure out a cleverer way to do this)

Queries the device configuration.

docs.title: Payload:
docs.text: • Arg 0 (string): Device configuration JSON object

docs.title: Set Device Config
docs.text:
Function: set_cfg_from_json Source: cfg.rs

⚠️ NOTE: WILL BE DEPRECATED ONCE DEVICE CONFIG GETS TOO BIG TO FIT IN A UDP PACKET (or I figure out a cleverer way to do this)

Overwrites the device configuration.

docs.title: Payload:
docs.text: • Arg 0 (string | blob): Device configuration JSON object

docs.title: Effects
docs.text: Overwrites device configuration with the JSON object. If the JSON is an invalid device configuration, the existing configuration will not be overwritten.

docs.title: Wipe Device Config
docs.text:
Function: wipe_config Source: cfg.rs

Resets the device configuration to factory defaults.

docs.title: Effects
docs.text: Overwrites the entire device configuration with the default initialization values.

docs.title: Get Config Section - Device ID
docs.text:
Function: get_device_id Source: cfg.rs

Queries the device ID configuration section.

docs.title: Payload:
docs.text: • Arg 0 (string): Device ID JSON object

docs.title: Set Config Section - Device ID
docs.text:
Function: set_device_id Source: cfg.rs

Overwrites the device ID configuration section.

docs.title: Payload:
docs.text: • Arg 0 (string | blob): Device ID JSON object

docs.title: Effects
docs.text: Overwrites device ID configuration section with the JSON object. If the JSON is invalid, the existing configuration will not be overwritten.

docs.title: Get Config Section - Metadata
docs.text:

Queries the metadata configuration section.

docs.title: Payload:
docs.text: • Arg 0 (string): Metadata JSON object

docs.text:

Overwrites the metadata configuration section.

docs.title: Payload:
docs.text: • Arg 0 (string | blob): Metadata JSON object

docs.title: Effects
docs.text: Overwrites metadata configuration section with the JSON object. If the JSON is invalid, the existing configuration will not be overwritten.

docs.title: Get Config Section - Local IP
docs.text:
Function: get_local_ip Source: cfg.rs

Queries the local IP configuration section.

docs.title: Payload:
docs.text: • Arg 0 (string): Local IP JSON object

docs.title: Set Config Section - Local IP
docs.text:
Function: set_local_ip Source: cfg.rs

Overwrites the local IP configuration section.

docs.title: Payload:
docs.text: • Arg 0 (string | blob): Local IP JSON object

docs.title: Get Config Section - OSC
docs.text:
Function: get_osc Source: cfg.rs

Queries the OSC configuration section.

docs.title: Payload:
docs.text: • Arg 0 (string): OSC JSON object

docs.title: Set Config Section - OSC
docs.text:
Function: set_osc Source: cfg.rs

Overwrites the OSC configuration section.

docs.title: Payload:
docs.text: • Arg 0 (string | blob): OSC JSON object

docs.title: Effects

docs.title: Set Response Port
docs.text:
Function: set_response_port Source: cfg.rs

Sets the UDP port number used for OSC response messages.

docs.title: Payload:
docs.text: • Arg 0 (int | float): UDP port number for responses

docs.title: Effects
docs.text: Updates the device configuration to send all OSC response messages to the specified port.

docs.title: Subscribe Me
docs.text:
Function: subscribe_me Source: cfg.rs

Adds an endpoint to the list of subscribers that receive event notifications.

docs.title: Payload:
docs.text: • Arg 0 (OPTIONAL - int | float): Port number of the subscriber, if necessary

docs.title: Effects
docs.text: Registers the source endpoint as a subscriber. If sent over network, the subscriber will be added as either TCP or UDP, depending on the source protocol, and the subscriber's socket address will be the source IP and the supplied port. If a port is not supplied, it will default to the configured response port. If a subscription request is sent over USB, the port is not necessary. The device will send OSC event messages (e.g., digital input changes) to all registered subscribers. Returns an error if the subscriber is already registered or the maximum number of subscribers is reached.

docs.title: Unsubscribe
docs.text:
Function: unsubscribe_me Source: cfg.rs

Removes an endpoint from the list of event notification subscribers.

docs.title: Payload:
docs.text: • Arg 0 (OPTIONAL - int | float): Port number of the subscriber to remove

docs.title: Effects
docs.text: Removes the source from the subscriber list, with the specified port number (if necessary). If a request is received from a UDP source with no specified port, it will default to trying the configured response port. Returns an error if the endpoint is not in the subscriber list.

docs.title: Provision Serial Number
docs.text:
Function: provision_serial_number Source: cfg.rs

Sets the device serial number in EEPROM.

docs.title: Payload:
docs.text: • Arg 0 (string): Serial number to write

docs.title: Effects
docs.text: Writes the provided serial number to the device's EEPROM storage. This is typically used during device provisioning.

docs.title: Set Digital Input Event Message
docs.text:
Function: set_di_event_message Source: cfg.rs

Configures a custom OSC message to be sent to subscribers when a digital input state changes.

docs.title: Payload:
docs.text:
• Arg 0 (int | float | True | False): Input state trigger (0/false for off, 1/true for on)
  • Arg 1 (string | blob): Address of new event message. Example: "/cue/20/go"
  • Arg 2+ (OPTIONAL - ANY): After the required arguments, up to 10 optional arguments provided in this configuration message will be packed into the new event message.

NOTE: Event messages have an encoded size limitation of 128 bytes.

docs.title: Example:
docs.text: Message: /sio/cfg/eventmsg/di/3/set (T), (s)/fader1/set, (i)255 - Arg 0 (True): this event message will trigger when the digital input changes state to True - Arg 1 (string): the event message will have an address of "/fader1/set" - Arg 2 (int): the event message will include an integer argument of 255

docs.title: Effects
docs.text: Stores a custom OSC message in the device configuration. When the specified digital input channel changes to the specified state, the custom message will be sent to all registered subscribers.

docs.title: Discovery Commands
docs.text: These OSC commands allow clients to discover ShowIO devices on the network.

docs.title: Device Discovery
docs.text:
Function: handle_discovery_request Source: discovery.rs

Responds to a discovery request with device information including name, serial number, and port.

docs.title: Payload:
docs.text: • Arg 0 (int | float): Response port number

docs.title: Payload:
docs.text:
• Arg 0 (string): Device name
  • Arg 1 (string): Serial number
  • Arg 2 (int): UDP receive port

docs.title: I/O Commands
docs.text: These OSC commands control and query the digital I/O channels.

docs.title: Set Digital Output
docs.text:
Function: set_digital_output Source: io.rs

Sets the state of a digital output channel.

docs.title: Payload:
docs.text: • Arg 0 (int | float | True | False): Output state (0/false for off, non-zero/true for on)

docs.title: Effects
docs.text: Changes the state of the specified digital output channel (1-4).

docs.title: Get Digital Output
docs.text:
Function: get_digital_output Source: io.rs

Queries the current state of a digital output channel.

docs.title: Payload:
docs.text: • Arg 0 (int): Output state (0 for off, 1 for on)

docs.title: Get Digital Input
docs.text:
Function: get_digital_input Source: io.rs

Queries the current state of a digital input channel.

docs.title: Payload:
docs.text: • Arg 0 (int): Input state (0 for low, 1 for high)

docs.title: Get All Digital Inputs
docs.text:
Function: get_all_di_state Source: io.rs

Queries the current state of all digital input channels.

docs.title: Payload:
docs.text:
• Arg 0 (int): Channel 1 state (0 for low, 1 for high)
  • Arg 1 (int): Channel 2 state (0 for low, 1 for high)
  • Arg 2 (int): Channel 3 state (0 for low, 1 for high)
  • Arg 3 (int): Channel 4 state (0 for low, 1 for high)

docs.title: Utility Commands
docs.text: These OSC commands provide utility functions for debugging and testing.

docs.title: Ping
docs.text:
Function: ping_handler Source: misc.rs

Responds to a ping request with a pong message, echoing back the provided arguments.

docs.title: Payload:
docs.text:
• Arg 0 (any): Message ID to echo back
  • Arg 1 (any): Additional data to echo back

docs.title: Payload:
docs.text:
• Arg 0 (any): Echoed message ID from request
  • Arg 1 (any): Echoed additional data from request

docs.title: Default Handler
docs.text:
Function: default_handler Source: misc.rs

Fallback handler for OSC messages that don't match any registered route. Logs the message address and arguments for debugging.

docs.title: Effects
docs.text: Logs the received message address and argument count to the debug output.

docs.title: OSC API
docs.text: A description of the OSC API

docs.title: Configuration API
docs.text:
OSC Methods in the /sio/cfg/ branch allow the user to configure a ShowIO device.

Method Address Get Device Config /sio/cfg/get Set Digital Input Event Message /sio/cfg/eventmsg/di/{channel}/set

docs.title: Set Digital Input Event Message
docs.text:
Configures a custom OSC message to be sent to subscribers when a digital input state changes.

Warning

Event messages have an encoded size limitation of 128 bytes.

docs.title: Address
docs.text:
/sio/cfg/eventmsg/di/{channel}/set
...where {channel} is a single character channel number.

docs.title: Payload
docs.text:
• Arg 0 (int | float | True | False): Input state trigger (0/false for off, 1/true for on)
  • Arg 1 (string | blob): Address of new event message. Example: "/cue/20/go"
  • Arg 2+ (OPTIONAL - any): After the required arguments, up to 10 optional arguments provided in this configuration message will be packed into the new event message.

docs.title: Effects
docs.text: Stores a custom OSC message in the device configuration. When the specified digital input channel changes to the specified state, the custom message will be sent to all registered subscribers.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
Message: /sio/cfg/eventmsg/di/3/set T, /fader1/set, 255

  • Arg 0 (True): this event message will trigger when the digital input changes state to True
  • Arg 1 (string): the event message will have an address of "/fader1/set"
  • Arg 2 (int): the event message will include an integer argument of 255

docs.title: Supported Devices
docs.text: • ShowIO PROTO5

docs.title: Get Device Config
docs.text:
Get a JSON string of the device configuration.

Address: /sio/cfg/get Payload: none

⚠️ NOTE: WILL BE DEPRECATED ONCE DEVICE CONFIG GETS TOO BIG TO FIT IN A UDP PACKET (or I figure out a cleverer way to do this)

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
Address: /sio/cfg Payload:

  • [0] (string): Device configuration JSON object
